title: Possible Game Mode
body:
I was thinking it would be a fun idea to have a map where it was 4v4v4 or 5v5v5 and the objectives were a capture and hold nodes for resources that would stockpile right beside the node for the players to take back to base. (resources can only be picked up by the team who generated them but if they die and drop it then it is free for all). 

The resources would be used to upgrade your base in 3 different ways: (all upgrades last 6 minutes)
1. Build a moat that slows enemy movement by 30%
2. Upgrade towers to do increased damage also area damage
3. Protect the base in a magical barrier that grants a temporary shield to allies when they pass through it and absorbs 50% of enemy ranged attacks.

The map would be a circular shape with a node between each team base. At the middle of the map would be a boss monster that gives a party buff or a huge payload of resources. Roaming monsters of increasing difficulty will be found throughout the map. (each time a group of monsters is destroyed they re-spawn stronger, so a tactic would be take out enemy monster patrols to make it harder for them to gather resources)

The aim of the game would be to take out your enemies bases and protect your own by gathering resources to upgrade defenses. If a team is aced by the enemy they lose a random upgrade to their base.  Surrender option will only be available once 1 team's base is destroyed.

The picture attached is a rough outline of the map:
red, green and yellow dots are team bases
blue dots are resource nodes
and purple dot is boss monster
the lines between them all are roaming monster routes

So there it is!  Let me know what your thoughts are?

Corvis Colvein

replies.body:
say it was just a 3 team nexus fight, you could make it the first team that destroys an enemy nexus wins, so you wouldn't have a whole team waiting for the game to end because it would end at first nexus defeated.

The roaming monsters would still be fun to have.

The resource gathering isn't necessary, although the nodes could be made into extra gold per 5 seconds for the team who owns them

I don't quite like the concept, but I have always liked the idea of a LoL gamemode with three teams. I would prefer the standard nexus setup on something which is like a Y for this, and think it could turn out quite interesting. For example, if one team was getting ahead the other two teams could work together to beat them down. However, my thoughts on something like that would be that it is cool... but... but... could you imagine if your team lost and then you were sitting there waiting for the game to end for half an hour? Damn.

I just thought a game mode that wasn't focusing on kill count and had a little more strategy by having 3 teams instead of 2...

But thanks for your feedback
